contentList.content: Choose an ability score to increase by 2, if you gain more than one increase, you can’t apply those increases to the same ability score, and you can’t increase a score above 20.
A ring, stud, or other piece of jewelry worn in a pierced part of the body.

Any trait that lets you cast a spell now allows you to cast that spell using any spell slots you have. You also get to decide whether to use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting ability for these spells when selecting your race.
Always on the lookout for danger, when you roll Initiative, you can add your Proficiency Bonus to the roll.
You gain the following Armor Training: Light Armor, Medium Armor, and Shield.
You are a practiced musician, you gain proficiency with Musical Instruments. You can play a Musical Instrument and give Inspiration to allies who hear the song.

Several more racial rarities call Faerûn their home. These people strive and suffer along with the other mortal races—but their existences are far and few between compared to the standard races of Faerûn, adding a touch of wonder and uniqueness to those unfamiliar with them.
You can replace all the proficiencies granted by the Keen Senses trait to another proficiency of your choice.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being Charmed.

Some magic items require a creature to form a bond with them before their magical Properties can be used. This bond is called attunement, and certain items have a prerequisite for it. If the prerequisite is a class, a creature must be a member of that class to attune to the item.
You have become possessed by the thirst that grips all Vampires.

You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane. You gain proficiency in one weapon of your choice,as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane. These proficiencies last until the end of your next long rest.

You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane. You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane. These proficiencies last until the end of your next long rest.
Whenever you finish a long rest using your Trance trait, you gain two proficiencies, each one with a weapon of your choice.
You mystically acquire proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory after completing a trancelike meditiation.

Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races. Their ambition and resourcefulness are commended, respected, and feared.
Found throughout the multiverse, humans are as varied as they are numerous. They strive to achieve as much as they can in the years they are given.

Goliaths have physical characteristics that are reminiscent of the giants in their family lines.
Towering over most folk, Goliaths are distant descendants of giants. Each Goliath bears the blessings of the first giants.
Distantly related to giants and infused with the supernatural essence of their ancestors' mountainous home.

When you take damage you can use your Reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.
Using your Reaction you deal 1d8 Thunder Damage after being attacked by a creature.
When you take damage from a creature within 60 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to deal 1d8 Thunder damage to that creature.

You have resistance to cold damage. You also naturally acclimate to high altitudes, even if you’ve never been to one.
Beings armed with gifts to help them thrive on worlds beset by monsters. Orcs retain the gifts that Gruumsh bestowed upon them: might, endurance, determination, and the ability to see in the dark.

Tiefling's are linked by blood to a devil, a demon, a yugoloth, or some other Fiend.
Baalzebul, who excels at corrupting those whose minor sins can be transformed into acts of damnation. Tieflings linked to this archdevil can corrupt others both physically and psychically.
Dis occupies most of Hell’s second layer. It is a place where secrets are uncovered and shared with the highest bidder, making tieflings tied to Dispater excellent spies and infiltrators.
A master manipulator, Fierna grants tieflings tied to her forceful personalities.
Glasya, Hell’s criminal mastermind, grants her tieflings magic that is useful for committing heists.
Frozen Stygia is ruled by Levistus, an archdevil known for offering bargains to those who face an inescapable doom.
In the frozen realm of Cania, Mephistopheles offers arcane power to those who entreat with him. Tieflings linked to him master some arcane magic.
You know the Thaumaturgy cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the Spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish Legacy trait.
The hearless entropy of the Abyss, the howling chaos of Pandemonium, and the vast despair of Carceri call to tieflings who have the Abyssal fiendish legacy.
You have resistance to Poison Damage, and know the Poison Spray Cantrip.
Tieflings who have the Chthonic fiendish legacy not only feel the tug of Carceri but also the greed of Gehenna and the underworld gloom of hades.
You have resistance to Necrotic damage. You also know the Chill Touch Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast False Life, at 5th you can cast Ray of Enfeeblement.
The Infernal fiendish legacy binds tieflings by blood not only to Gehenna but also the raging battlefields of Acheron and the diabolical Nine Hells. You have resistance to Fire Damage.
You also know the Fire Bolt cantrip.
Tieflings who have the Maladomini fiendish legacy can corrupt others both physically and psychically. You have resistance to Psychic damage.
You also know the Mind Sliver Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Ray of Sickness, at 5th you can cast Crown of Madness.
Tieflings who have the Dis fiendish legacy are tied to Dispater and make excellent spies and infiltrators. You have resistance to Poison damage.
You also know the Friends Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Disguise Self, at 5th you can cast Detect Thoughts.
Tieflings who have the Phlegethos fiendish legacy inherit Fierna's boon, tied to her forceful personalities. You have resistance to Psychic damage.
You also know the Friends Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Charm Person, at 5th you can cast Suggestion.
Tieflings who have the Malbolge fiendish legacy are granted by Glasya magic that is useful for comitting heists. You have resistance to Poison damage.
You also know the Friends Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Disguise Self, at 5th you can cast Invisibility.
Tieflings who have the Stygia fiendish legacy are those who are tied to Levistus. You have resistance to Cold damage.
You also know the Ray of Frost Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Armor of Agathys, at 5th you can cast Darkness.
Tieflings who have the Cania fiendish legacy are those who are tied to Levistus. You have resistance to Fire damage.
You also know the Mage Hand Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Burning Hands, at 5th you can cast Flame Blade.
People with beastlike heads, keen senses, and an innate connection to divine magic. Long ago, the ancestors of Ardlings migrated to the Material Plane, and Ardlings can now be found on many worlds.
Groups of elves ventured from the Feywild to the Astral Plane to be closer to their gods. Life in the Silver Void has imbued their souls with a spark of divine light.

A physical and magical transformation that alters you in fundamental ways. You can still appear as you once were, but you’ve changed in significant ways that overwrite your once physical or magical capabilities.

If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it. If you don’t keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
Your lineage grants you any <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with two <LSTag Tooltip="Skill">Skills</LSTag> of your choice.
Your lineage has consumed the elements of your previous life. Choose whether your character is a member of the human race or one of the fantastical races.

Poised between the worlds of the living and the dead, dhampirs retain their grip on life yet are endlessly tested by vicious hungers. Dhampirs often arise from encounters with vampires, but all manner of macabre bargains, necromantic influences, and encounters with mysterious immortals might have transformed you.

You don’t need to breathe. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to the following: <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SUFFOCATING">Suffocating</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED_CLOUD">Poisonous Fumes</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STINKING_CLOUD">Nauseous</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BIBBERBANG_FUMES">Noxious Fumes</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STENCH_GHAST">Ghastly Fumes</LSTag>.

You briefly transform into a swarm of bats and move to an unoccupied space you can see, during the transformations duration you don't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>.

You can magically turn into a swarm of bats to move to an unoccupied space you can see, during this time you gain a flying speed equal to <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement</LSTag>. Furthermore, you don't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> while briefly transformed.
You form reverts back to normal after you move to the unoccupied space.

Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag>. You add your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> to the attack and damage rolls with this bite.

When you attack with this bite and hit a creature that isn’t a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVIGORATING_BITE_TECHNICAL">Invigorating Bite</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EXHILIRATING_BITE_TECHNICAL">Exhilirating Bite</LSTag>.

You use fangs as a natural weapon. Add your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> to your attack and damage rolls, dealing [1] with your bite.

You can empower your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Trait_VampiricBite">fanged bite</LSTag> to gain the following benfits <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVIGORATING_BITE_TECHNICAL">Invigorating Bite</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EXHILIRATING_BITE_TECHNICAL">Exhilirating Bite</LSTag> a number of times equal to <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. You regain this resource after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

While you are missing half or more of your <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> using <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Trait_VampiricBite">Vampiric Bite</LSTag>.
You regain as many <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> equal to the total damage dealt by <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Trait_VampiricBite">Vampiric Bite</LSTag>.

After you deal damage with your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Trait_VampiricBite">fanged bite</LSTag>, you gain a bonus to the next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> you make, the bonus is equal to 1d4.
You gain a bonus to your next <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> equal to 1d4.

You can empower yourself with this bite a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, all expended uses are restored upon completing a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Death isn’t always the end. The reborn exemplify this, being individuals who have died yet, somehow, still live. Reborn might originate from circumstances similar to those of various undead or constructs. Their memories of events before are often vague or absent. Occasionally, the most unexpected experiences might cause sensations or visions of the past to come rushing back.
You have escaped death, a fact represented by the following benefits. You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.

You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe. You don’t need to sleep, and magic can’t put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a d6 and add the number to the d20 check.

You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a d6 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d6 to the check.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Hexbloods are individuals infused with eldritch magic, fey energy, or mysterious witchcraft. A bargain with a hag or other eerie forces transformed you into a magical being.
As a bonus action, you can harmlessly remove a eye.
This token is imbued with magic until you finish a long rest.

You can cast the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShieldShove">Disguise Self</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ShieldShove">Hex</LSTag> spells with this trait. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
You can see and hear from the token as if you were located where it is. While you are using your senses at the token's location you are blinded and defeaned in regard to your own surroundings.
Once you create a token using this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, at which point your missing part regrows.
Blessed with resistance to magical and poisonous effects by the rituals that created them, each of these yuan-ti manifests their serpentine heritage in a variety of ways.

You know the poison spray cantrip. You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast suggestion with this trait. Once you cast it, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. In addition, you can cast those spells using any spell slots you have. You also get to decide whether to use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting ability for these spells.
You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.

You know the poison spray cantrip. You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast suggestion with this trait. Once you cast it, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait.
The serpent creatures known as yuan-ti are all that remains of an ancient, decadent human empire.
You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells.

Born of dragons, as their name proclaims, the dragonborn walk proudly through a world that greets them with fearful incomprehension. Shaped by draconic gods or the dragons themselves, dragonborn originally hatched from dragon eggs as a unique race, combining the best attributes of dragons and humanoids.

Dragonborn with chromatic ancestry claim the raw elemental power of chromatic dragons. The vibrant colors of black, blue, green, red, and white dragons gleam in those dragonborn’s scaled skin and in the deadly energy of their breath weapons.
Draconbloods possess long tails and a knack for social manipulation. They remember the days when they were once mighty conquerors.

You can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, on failed save creatures take [1] and on successful save creatures take [2].
You can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a [1] line that is [2] wide. On failed save creatures take [3] and on successful save creatures take [4].
You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to [1] and regain all uses when you Finish a Long Rest.

You learn to channel the magical energy of your Draconic Ancestry to give yourself temporary flight. You sprout spectral wings on your back that last for 10 minutes, or until you are Incapacitated or retract the wings as a Bonus Action.
You can replace one of your attacks with magical energy in a 15-foot cone or in a [1] line that is [2] wide.
Spectral wings associated with the element of your Draconic Ancestry.

Gem dragonborn partake of the heritage of gem dragons, who claim to be heirs of Sardior, the Ruby Dragon. The colors and mysterious powers of gem dragons—amethyst, crystal, emerald, sapphire, and topaz—gleam in these dragonborn’s scaled skin and course through their veins.
You have a Amethyst Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Crystal Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Emerald Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Sapphire Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Topaz Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You can use a bonus action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.
Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

Dragonborn with metallic ancestry lay claim to the tenacity of metallic dragons—brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver—whose hues glint in their scales. Theirs is the fire of hearth and forge, the cold of high mountain air, the spark of inspiration, and the scouring touch of acid that purifies.
Ravenites have no tails and a hearty physique. They remember the days when they were slaves to the draconblood, as well as the day when they overthrew their masters.
When you take damage from a creature in range of a weapon you are wielding, you can use your reaction to make an attack with the weapon against that creature.
After you take damage from a creature, you can make an attack with your weapon against that creature.
Eladrin are elves of the Feywild, a realm of perilous beauty and boundless magic.

As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> + your Charisma modifier.

You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Immediately after up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within [1] of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Some Eladrin remain associated with a particular season for their entire lives, whereas other Eladrin transform, adopting characteristics of a new season. An eladrin’s season can change, though some remain in one season forever. Choose your season whenever you finish this trance, you can change your season.
When finishing a long rest, any Eladrin can change their season.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of Autumn. You inherit autumns boon becoming a Autumn Eladrin.
You embrace the season of peace and goodwill, when summer’s harvest is shared with all.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of Winter. You inherit winters boon becoming a Winter Eladrin.
You embrace the season of contemplation and dolor, when the vibrant energy of the world slumbers.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of spring. You inherit Springs boon becoming a Spring Eladrin.
You embrace the season of cheerfulness and celebration, marked by merriment as winter’s sorrow passes.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of summer. You inherit Summers boon becoming a Summer Eladrin.
You embrace the season of boldness and aggression, a time of unfettered energy.
The season of boldness and aggression, a time of unfettered energy. When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season.
You can magically teleport up to [1] to an unoccupied space you can see. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within [2] of you takes [3].
Genasi carry the power of the elemental planes of air, earth, fire, and water in their blood.
Embodying many of the airy traits of their otherworldly ancestors, air genasi can draw upon their connection to the winds.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to lightning damage.

You can hold your breath indefinitely while you’re not incapacitated. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to the following: <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SUFFOCATING">Suffocating</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED_CLOUD">Poisonous Fumes</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STINKING_CLOUD">Nauseous</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BIBBERBANG_FUMES">Noxious Fumes</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STENCH_GHAST">Ghastly Fumes</LSTag>.

You know the shocking grasp cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the feather fall spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Blur spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast feather fall or levitate with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Embodying many of the airy traits of their otherwordly ancestors, air genasi can draw upon their connection to the winds.
Tracing their ancestry to dao, the genies of the Elemental Plane of Earth, earth genasi inherit dao’s steadfast strength and control over earth.

You can move across <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag> without expending extra <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement</LSTag> whenever you traverse accross a terrene surface.

You know the blade ward cantrip. You can cast it as normal, and you can also cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

You know the blade ward cantrip. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the pass without trace spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast that spell with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
Whenever you use the blade ward cantrip, you can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
Descended from efreet, the genies of the Elemental Plane of Fire, fire genasi channel the flamboyant and often destructive nature of flame.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to fire damage.

You know the produce flame cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_BurningHands">Burning Hands</LSTag>, at 5th level, you can also cast the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_FlameBlade">Flame Blade</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> is used for these <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spells</LSTag> when you cast them with this trait.
Water genasi are perfectly suited to life underwater and carry the power of the waves inside themselves.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the innate spells you inherit.
You have resistance to acid damage.

You know the acid splash cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the create or destroy water spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the moonbeam spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast create or destroy water or moonbeam with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Originally from the Elemental Plane of Water, many tritons entered the Material Plane centuries ago in response to the growing threat of evil elementals. Over time, triton have extended their stewardship over the sea floor to the ocean’s surface.
You can breathe air and water.

You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FogCloud">Fog Cloud</LSTag> with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_GustOfWind">Gust of Wind</LSTag> with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WaterWalk">Water Walk</LSTag> with it.

You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_FogCloud">Fog Cloud</LSTag>, at 3rd level you can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Zone_GustOfWind">Gust of Wind</LSTag>, and at 5th level you can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WaterWalk">Water Walk</LSTag>. You can cast these spells once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> with this trait, or with any <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> you have of the appropriate level or higher.

Beyond the rage of Gruumsh, half-orcs feel emotion powerfully. Rage doesn’t just quicken their pulse, it makes their bodies burn. An insult stings like acid, and sadness saps their strength. But they laugh loudly and heartily, and simple pleasures fill their hearts with joy. They tend to be short-tempered and sometimes sullen, more inclined to action than contemplation and to fighting than arguing. And when their hearts swell with love, they leap to perform acts of great kindness and compassion.
The Mark of Finding sharpens the senses, guiding the hunter to prey. Alone among the dragonmarks, the Mark of Finding is carried by two races: humans and half-orcs.

Long before the god Maglubiyet conquered them, early goblins served in the court of the Queen of Air and Darkness, one of the Feywild’s archfey. Goblins thrived in her dangerous domain thanks to a special boon from her—a supernatural knack for finding the weak spots in foes larger than themselves and for getting out of trouble.

These resilient and proud fish-folk have endured war, slavery, and mistreatment at the hands of other aquatic creatures.

Long before humanity, and before even the elves and dwarves rose to prominence, the empire of another race ruled over Etharis. Some of its people foresaw the great calamity that would claim their kingdom and locked themselves away in stasis vaults below the Stehlenwald Mountains to sleep through the apocalypse. Awakened by the mining dwarves, the dreamers have returned to the world, evolved to use the power of dreams as if they were memories.
While asleep, a dreamer can reach out and touch the dreams of others within 1 mile. After finishing a long rest, and provided you slept during that time, you may choose one skill.
Until your next long rest, you may add a bonus equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to any rolls you make using the selected skill.

Its members are either part of the mythic caste that oversees all things related to the not living, from funerals to construction, or are a member of the warrior caste that focuses on the living, such as warfare or farming.

You have undergone the Rite of Tann’lia, the soul of your dead twin is now bound to your own. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to psychic damage, and you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> saves against magic.

The first time this trait activates after a long rest, you must make a DC 12 <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> saving throw. If you fail, your twin’s spirit attempts to wrest control away from you, leaving you stunned until the end of your next turn.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> saves against magic. If you fail, your twin’s spirit attempts to wrest control away from you, leaving you stunned until the end of your next turn.
Sizable humanoids with a talent for social interaction, ogresh are rare and not usually encountered together.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with two of the following skills of your choice: <LSTag Tooltip="Persuasion">Persuasion</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Insight">Insight</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Deception">Deception</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Performance">Performance</LSTag>.

On a failed save, the target is charmed by you for one hour.
You can <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charm</LSTag> a non-hostile creature and learn information.

Nowadays, centuries past their imprisonment, dragontouched live among other races. Their draconic touch does not fade with time, and the powers that it grants remain strong, but rather than being forced to use these powers to serve, they use them as they see fit to pursue their own goals. Freedom is incredibly highly valued by the dragontouched, and they are fierce defendants of their right and the rights of everyone else to do as they wish. Contrary to most dragonborn, dragontouched culture is not particularly collectivist, and see individuality and the needs and rights of the individual as paramount.

Your efforts or natural talent have rewarded you expertise in a skill, choose one skill. Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the selected skill.
Your efforts or natural talent have rewarded you expertise in a skill, add twice your proficiency bonus to Stealth checks.

Reclusive human civilization's sought to achieve humanity's evolutionary peak, shaping themselves through rapid evolutionary change by undergoing clandestine sangromancy rituals; becoming Krsnik. Krsnik obtained genetic advantages and disadvantages due to this process but became more than capable of defending humanity against the horrors of the dark.
Your body is capable of closing wounds that it has sustained, on it's own.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Mušhuššu have obtained incredibly long lifespans and youth by shedding their aged bodies to maintain their semi-immortality. Inheriting a deeper connection to serpents than their Yuan-ti counterparts, having traits more akin to their draconic serpent god's visage; a benison resulting in sterility and infertility; only through obtaining more disciples of Mušhuššu does their kin continue to exist.
A stigma that tethers you to Mušhuššu, making your appearance more similar to the draconic serpent.
You have blindsight up to [1], you are capable of perceiving your surroundings without relying on sight, within a [1]. radius.
You have resistance to cold damage. Additionally, you have immunity to the poisoned condition.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright and have all your hit dice. You can expend all hit dice shedding your damaged body and arise with maximum hit points instead.
Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you have all of your Hit Dice again.

Nephilim are intrinsically entwined with fiends and celestials yet embraced by neither. Their otherworldly beauty and self-awareness of their beauty influence Nephilim to weave beauty into everything they do, performing with elegance and grace even when they are a combatant; To Nephilim, dignity is key.
You can use your free action to create a Armiger weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee or ranged weapon takes each time you create it.
You are proficient with your Armiger weapon and it is treated as magical. To summon a new Armiger weapon, you must dismiss the previous one.
Weapon inherited by your ancestral bloodline. When you attack with this weapon, you use your Spellcasting modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.
A weapon that carries the training and mastery of one of your Upper or Lower planes ancestors. Passed down from the old to the new through the bonding of blood.
You stow your Armiger arms, the weapon splits into subatomic particles and returns into your blood.

You can use your bonus action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your hair to turn into a luminous snow white color and your eyes to turn into pools of darkness. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it,

Lunari were once Elvenkind living alongside their elven kin, until becoming outcasts. Born anew, thriving among the horrors of the dark after the aftermath of their plights. Elvenkind that see the moonlight as a beacon of hope.
You are a Fey. You are also considered an elf for any prerequisite or effect that requires you to be an elf.
Hemōnari were once elves of the Feywild, desperate for a cure for a fatal disease that once plagued their kind. Gifted by the Dark Powers with a boon that tarnished and transformed their existence.

The dark powers magic that runs in your veins heightens your resilience to rotting or withering. You are immune to disease and when you take necrotic damage, reduce the damage you take by an amount equal to that Level.
In addition to this boon, the dark powers cure has cursed your body, weakening it against harm until you consume the dead. You are to all damage, excluding necrotic damage.
You can feed on a corpse to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to provided that it has been dead no longer than 10 days.
You can feed on a corpse to restore one hit dice, provided that it has been dead no longer than 10 days.

In addition, you have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks. Starting at 3rd level, you have immunity against non-magical piercing, slashing and bludgeoning damage. Beginning at 5th level, you have immunity against non-magical piercing, slashing and bludgeoning damage.

A sinister nature fuels your attacks. When you take damage by a creature, at the start of your next turn when you deal damage using a melee attack, roll 2 hit dice and you regain hit points equal to the total amount rolled.
Beginning at 5th level roll 1 additional dice, Starting at 10th level, roll 2 additional hit die. At 15th level, roll a total of 4 hit die.

Elves that are a characteristically tall stature and slender frame, having a variety of eye colors, light manifesting as a starry gleam in their eyes, with skin tones varying from umber and the more common gray to the occasional pale blue. The little known about Crepusriel is their acute sense of hearing, capable of detecting the faintest of sound. The uncanny awareness this grants has proven advantageous in battle.

You have heightened hearing, which provides you with instinctual reflexes, creating a uncanny defense against harm. While you aren't deaf, your hearing provides you with immunity against Surprised and Blind conditions. In addition, you have Blindsight and can add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to your Initiative.
Furthermore, while you aren't deaf you can't be surprised and are immune to the blind condition.

Using a Bonus Action, you can transform into an instrument of the departed, shrouded by those who had fallen by your enemies’ hands. Your transformation last for 10 minutes or until you end it as a Bonus Action. Once you transform using this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest. While shrouded by the Departed when you take necrotic damage, roll a d6. Add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to the number rolled, and reduce the damage you take by an amount equal to that total (minimum of 0 damage).

Moroi tread a fine line between mortality and undeath. Arising during a full or blood moon graced with their humanity and volition intact, unlike the lesser vampire, and bestowed a prominent vampiric ability inherited by their sovereign bloodline.
Prominant vampiric abilities inherited from the origin of your existance as a Dhampyr.
You are a humanoid and undead, you are immune to disease and can't be put to sleep magically due your connections to undeath.

Furthermore, You are vulnerable to Radiant damage; dark magic that runs in your veins heightens your natural defenses. When you take Necrotic damage reduce the damage you take by an amount equal to your total level.

You have become possessed by the thirst that grips all Vampires. In combat, this thirst drives you into an insatiable frenzy of bloodshed. Whenever you deal damage with weapon attacks to a target that can bleed, and is not undead or a construct, you gain a Blood Fury point.

You can have maximum of Blood Fury points equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. Whenever you take a short or long rest, the number of Blood Fury points resets to 0.
You can spend Blood Fury points to use prominent vampire abilities.
You've nurished your body, qwelling it's Sanguine lust.
Futhermore, you don't need to breathe.
You gain proficiency in Stealth, and your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is doubled when making Stealth ability checks.
You gain proficiency in Deception and Persuasion, and your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is doubled when making ability checks with both skills.
Whenever a creature within 5 ft. of you makes an attack against you, you may use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.
You can use your reaction and take half damage on a failed save and no damage on a successful one.
Until your next turn when you have rolled a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction and take half damage on a failed save and no damage on a successful one.

Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. You add your Constitution modifier, instead of your Strength modifier, to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with this bite.

Additionally, you can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage of your 3a5cecf5-0be0-4047-b2f4-57a751f703ce. This die changes as you gain levels, at 6th the dice replaced for a d8, at 10th the dice replaced for a d10, and at 14th the dice replaced for a d12.

You can make a special unarmed bite attack. This attack deals piercing damage. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or takes Necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to the Necrotic damage.
This attack generates 1 Blood Fury Point as normal. If it reduces a humanoid creature of size Medium or smaller to 0 hit points, you gain 3 Blood Fury points instead.
You can disappear in a puff of shadowy mist and teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
You can emit a ghastly distortion of your true form. A creature within [1] of you must succeed on a [2] saving throw or become [3]
A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to this ability for 24 hours.
Creature is immune to Deathly Horrors.
When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you may use this ability before damage is dealt. Add 1d6 of the same damage as your weapon to the damage result.
If this ability is used, no Fury Points are generated for this attack.
If this ability is used, no Fury Points are generated for this attack.
Whenever a creature within 5 ft. of you makes an attack against you, you may use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the attacking creature.

Your curse corrupts the magic you cast. Whenever you deal damage with a spell or cantrip you gain one Blood Fury point. Furthermore, whenever you cast a damage dealing Cantrip, you can add your constitution modifier to the damage you deal.
Undeath's grip on your existence has fortified your bodies regenerative capabilities.
You regain hit points equal to your [1] at the start of your turn, if you have at least 1 hit point and you're not in sunlight or running water.

Undeath's grip on your existence has fortified your bodies regenerative capabilities. You regain hit points equal to your Constitution Modifier at the start of your turn, if you have at least 1 hit point and you're not in sunlight or running water.
After feeding on a creature with your Sovereign Fangs you can then unlock one Bloodline Inheritance. After you do so you can't use this trait until you finish a Long Rest.

You are part of a Sovereign Vampire lineage that grants you unfathomable powers. Only after feeding on a creature can you harvest one Bloodline Inheritances. You can replace that Bloodline Inheritance with another after a long rest and feeding on another creature.

Vampyr tread a fine line between mortality and undeath. Renowned by undead creatures as Children of the Blue Moon, variants of Dhampyr ilk that inherited a sovereign vampire's bloodline on a blue moon bestowing all prominent prowess of a vampire. Their volition remains intact merely to undergo a trial, all for their benefactor's amusement. Enduring an internal struggle of risking forsaking their fleeting humanity, descending into vampirism; Unrestrained by their thirst for blood but allured by their thirst for the dark prowess.

Gwŷddpāla are individuals who met their end while having lingering desires before those last moments. Primal magic from Alacritātis has returned you to the realm of the living; as a fey with a wooden doll-esque vessel and a deep-rooted desire to protect Malipāla. Outside of this desire, Gwŷddpāla's volition dictates their alignment.

Primal magic enhances your senses. You gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TREMORSENSE_TERRESTRIAL">Tremorsense</LSTag> and can perceive your surroundings without relying on sight within [1], outside of this range you are naturally <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blind</LSTag>.

Thanks to your fey origin, you are unfazed mind-affecting magic. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MADNESS">Madness</LSTag> condition.
Your vessel is warded by primal magic while in the presence of the sun. Whenever you are in direct Sunlight you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to all damage from spells.

Tydelvian are known as "Guardians of the Shores" in Malipāla, an ancient aquatic race of humanoids with distinctive large fin-like ears, sharp triangular teeth, and a trio of gills on both sides of their faces, shoulders, and rib cage. The Tydelvian have ensured Malipāla remains clandestine from the undesired while also serving as ferries to the initiated of Malipāla seeking the world beyond. Because of this, they are some of the most trusted and respected adventurers of Malipāla.
You have become accustomed to the horrors of vast ocean depths, you are immune to fear.

You can tap into innate Primal magic from the element of water, harnessing the natural life energy contained within water. Useing your reaction and 1 hit dice to heal an allied creature within 30 ft of you, the creature regains a number of hit points equal to your Level.

You can transform your body into a liquid state. When taking this shape you are resistant to fire damage, and immune to slashing, bludgeoning and piercing damage. In exchange your body becomes vulnerable to lightning and cold damage.
Your transformation last for 10 minutes or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your Tideborn shape, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Using a Bonus Action you can dismiss your Tideborn Transformation.

Dracodrin is the legacy of two long-forgotten races, one of celestial origin and the other of draconic fey origin. They are commonly mistaken for Eladrin or Aasimar due to similarities in appearance; however, Dracodrin are easily identified by their pointed ears, which have blue scaly dragon frills that reach the tips of the ears. They're creatures intensely devoted to love and friendship, seeking to make themselves strong, capable, and able to overcome any challenge, using their ancestral boons for the good of others. Dracodrin move and speak at a calm, measured pace and have a tendency to conceal their more affectionate traits; this deliberate pacing was started to help tame their emotions and maintain level-headiness.
When you reach 3rd level, you choose what version of your anscestors blood flows within your veins.

You are dead, yet live. Shadow magic binds you to a vessel that was either yours or another, yet your volition still remains intact. Considered abominations of the natural order, nothing but the memories of a cruel and undeserved end welcome you to the material plane.
You've met with a terrible fate, your creature type is Undead.
You have escaped death, a fact represented by the following benefits. You are immune to disease and being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.

You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe. You don’t need to sleep, and magic can’t put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.
If you are below half your hit point maximum at the start of your turn, you regain [1].
Furthermore, if damage reduces you to [1], unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the you drops to [2] instead.

The Hyur champion personal freedom and liberty, and their espousal of an eclectic variety of languages and traditions is a legacy of their diverse heritage as is their resulting lack of a unified cultural identity.
Two distinct groups now exist among the Hyur; Highlanders, denizens of the mountainous areas, and Midlanders, who reside in lower elevations.
Highlanders, denizens of the mountainous areas, Hyur with noticeably larger in build and musculature.
Hyur, who reside in lower elevations. Midlander's heritage cultivated the importance of education.

Midlander's heritage has cultivated the importance of education. Trained in letters from infancy their diverse education has forged Midlander's to be fearless, and to approach task with educated precision.

You gain the upper hand when fighting with allies. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against a target if one of your allies is within [1] of the target and isn't Incapacitated.
Highlanders are noticeably larger in build and musculature. A heritage blessed with physical prowess to endure and perform unfathomable feats.

When you score a Critical Hit with a melee or unarmed attack you deal an extra dice of damage. Furthermore, you reduce Slashing, Bludgenoning and Piercing damage equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
Deals an extra 1d8 damage when attacking with a melee weapon.
The Elezen once claimed sole dominion over Eorzea, their presence predating that of the other races, and, as such, developed a heightened sense of honor and pride.
Both possessing keen senses and believe the realm to be theirs by divine right, a gift from the Twelve themselves.

Elezen who have spent centuries in peace and seclusion inside of caves and caverns, and despise the shackles of urban life. You are immune to the poison condition and can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical.
Furthermore, you mind has been sharpened by seclusion and meditation. You are immune to the Frightened, Madness, and Charmed conditions.
Elezen blessed with extremely keen eyesight, being afar is your natural expertise and allows you to discover a creatures vulnerabilities.
You work at a pace born from longevity that enhances your thoroughness
Full-blooded Garlean can be easily identified by their third eye. They are incapable of wielding Aether-based magick, and instead utilize Magitek.

You have a distinguished presence of a Third Eye on your forehead. This eye greatly improves your spatial recognition, you have advantage on perception checks. In addition your Range Weapon Attacks can reach targets at a greater distance and when you score a critical hit with Ranged Weapon Attacks, roll an additional damage dice.
Furthermore, you have disadvantage on Arcana checks and all spell attacks made by you roll at disadvantage.
When you make an skill check with Persuasion or Intimidation, add a Hit Dice to the check's total.
Many of the greatest warriors in history were born of Roegadyn stock. Known for their brawny builds and piercing eyes, the Roegadyn are the largest and most rugged of Eorzea’s heritages.
The majority of the realm’s Roegadyn belong to the Sea Wolf clan, a maritime people who earn their keep on or by the sea.
Comparatively fewer in numbers are the Hellsguard, who are known for their more earnest demeanors and can often be found working as bodyguards and smithies.
Many of the greatest warriors in history were born of Roegadyn stock.
You have proficiency with Persuasion skill checks.
Furthermore, when you make an ability check with this skill you add your total Level to the check's total.
You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned or put to sleep.

Hellsguard mind and body are tempered, displaying heightened endurances when faced with adversity. When you take damage by Slashing, Piercing, or Bludgeoning damage, reduce that damage by an amount equal to your total level.
